item.title: Jen add a quote by James Whorton
item.description: "...and we wandered through the casino gawking. It was kind of how I picture hell to be, with big dim rooms and hundreds of people packed in, and they're all working very hard but not getting anything done, and there's a constant racket of dingers going off, and sirens." -- James Whorton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nick Fowler
item.description: "I wondered just how much of her I'd invented. Had I only mastered some skill for awing myself? Or would this creature, Camilla, like a settler's incessant New World, keep increasing my capacity not only to marvel but to marvel at myself in the face of her?" -- Nick Fowler

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nick Fowler
item.description: "Having you in my life is so comforting, because it's like you feel and say all the same things I always did, but hearing you say them somehow confirms them for me, the way it's impossible to feel the same pleasure from running your own fingers through your own hair. What I'm trying to say is, you just can't tickle yourself." -- Nick Fowler

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nick Fowler
item.description: "What could be more intimate, more placental? This steamy, candlelit cradle she'd made use, twins tied in the womb. Grooming each other, letting the soil and torment that is the world's indifference disappear down the drain. Here, at last, was my partner. Tucked behind the wet walls of our sanctum. Here we could gleam anew with infant vigor, could refuel each other...with the will to believe again." -- Nick Fowler

item.title: Jen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What is right to be done cannot be done too soon." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jen add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Of lovers whose bodies smell of each other Who think the same thoughts without need of speech" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jen add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "As a bathtub lined with white porcelain, When the hot water gives out or goes tepid, So is the slow cooling of our chivalrous passion, O my much praised but-not-altogether-satisfactory lady. " -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Jen add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "What thou lovest well remains, " -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Jen add a quote by Deepak Chopra
item.description: "Whatever relationships you have attracted in your life at this moment, are precisely the ones you need in your life at this moment. There is a hidden meaning behind all events, and this hidden meaning is serving your own evolution." -- Deepak Chopra

item.title: Jen add a quote by Philip Dormer Stanhope
item.description: "Absolute power can only be supported by error, ignorance and prejudice. " -- Philip Dormer Stanhope

item.title: Jen add a quote by Philip Dormer Stanhope
item.description: "Vice, in its true light, is so deformed, that it shocks us at first sight; and would hardly ever seduce us, if it did not at first wear the mask of some virtue. " -- Philip Dormer Stanhope

item.title: Jen add a quote by Philip Dormer Stanhope
item.description: "Gratitude is a burden upon our imperfect nature, and we are but too willing to ease ourselves of it, or at least to lighten it as much as we can. " -- Philip Dormer Stanhope

item.title: Jen add a quote by Philip Dormer Stanhope
item.description: "I wish to God that you had as much pleasure in following my advice, as I have in giving it to you. " -- Philip Dormer Stanhope

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Even so, I must admire your skill. You are so gracefully insane." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "the man inside of woman ties a knot so that they will never again be separateâ€¦" -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "The soul was not cured, it was as full as a clothes closet of dresses that did not fit." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Yet love enters my blood like an I.V., dripping in its little white moments." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "She is so naked and singular. She is the sum of yourself and your dream. Climb her like a monument, step after step. She is solid." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "I am alone here in my own mind. There is no map and there is no road. It is one of a kind just as yours is." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Only my books anoint me, and a few friends, those who reach into my veins." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Now I am just an elderly lady who is full of spleen, who humps around greater Boston in a God-awful hat, who never lived and yet outlived her time, hating men and dogs and Democrats." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Jen add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "Nothing stands out so conspicuously, or remains so firmly fixed in the memory, as something which you have blundered." -- Cicero

item.title: Jen add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "I think it is all a matter of love; the more you love a memory the stronger and stranger it becomes" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Jen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What other words, we may almost ask, are memorable and worthy to be repeated than those which love has inspired? It is wonderful that they were ever uttered. They are few and rare indeed, but, like a strain of music, they are incessantly repeated and modulated by memory. All other words crumble off with the stucco which overlies the heart. We should not dare to repeat these now aloud. We are not competent to hear them at all times. " -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kenneth Clark
item.description: "Lives devoted to Beauty seldom end well. " -- Kenneth Clark

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "The tragedy of being both rational and animal seems to consist in having to choose between duty and desire rather than in making any particular choice" -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Jen add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "Our main business is not to see what lies dimly at a distance, but to do what lies clearly at hand. " -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Jen add a quote by Sydney Smith
item.description: "Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence. " -- Sydney Smith

item.title: Jen add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "If people knew the story of their lives, how many would then elect to live them? " -- Cormac McCarthy
